etymology.description: 雨(雨) (yǔ, "rain") + 伞(傘) (sǎn, "umbrella") = a device used for protection against rain
etymology.interpretation: The word 雨伞(雨傘) combines 雨(雨) (yǔ, "rain"), representing the weather element, with 伞(傘) (sǎn, "umbrella"), an object designed specifically to shield one from rain. This combination indicates a tool for keeping dry during rainy weather.
etymology.simplification: 伞 is the simplified form of 傘.

examples.chinese: 我今天带了雨伞(我今天帶了雨傘)。
外面下雨(外面下雨)，别忘了拿雨伞(別忘了拿雨傘)。
examples.pinyin: wàimiàn xiàyǔ, bié wàngle ná yǔsǎn。
examples.english: It is raining outside, don't forget to grab your umbrella.
